Name: Stela with ibis
Description: This small limestone stela, which comes from Tuna el-Gebel, belongs to the category of objects which were deposited as ex-voto in the temple of the god Thoth. It represents two rows of four ibis', illustrating in this way the epithet of the god of writing and knowledge, "Chief of the Eight". At the bottom of the stela, between the last pair of ibis, is read the name of Thoth followed by a priestly title. The piece dates from the New Kingdom.
